intro: Chirita limans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Chirita limans is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
